title: Consider Visual Impairments
text: Visual impairments can make it difficult to see images and graphs, and alternative text provides a description of images and graphs for those who cannot see them.

title: Avoiding Visual-Only Information
text: Relying solely on visual information can exclude those with visual impairments who need auditory aids.

title: Minimizing Complications
text: Using overly bright colors or too much on each presentation without adequate explanation can be overwhelming for viewers.

title: Talking Speed
text: Talking fast is not advisable for a presenter, but it will not change the visual aspects of the presentation.
